DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Blood Cell Count with Differential Specimen Included Evaluation Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether CBC and/or differential test results were included with the specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Blood Cell Count with Differential Specimen Included Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood to check the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, including the white cell differential, and platelets in a sample of blood included (put in as part of a set) with the specimen (a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Blood Cell Count with Differential Specimen Include Evaluation
Property.preferredDefinition: A hematologic procedure to determine the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets, including the white cell differential, in a blood sample.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: A hematologic procedure to determine the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets, including the white cell differential count and red cell morphology, in a blood sample.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
